sentence.Network_en: William was a man of discernment, with an eye for quality.

sentence.Network_en: He shows great discernment in his choice of friends.
He showed great discernment in his choice of wine.

entry.tran: 识别能力;洞察力;鉴赏能力
entry.def: Discernment is the ability to judge which things of a particular kind are good and which are bad.

example.ex: ...their lack of discernment and acceptance of inferior quality.
example.tran: 他们不识货，接受了劣质品

means.word_mean: 1. the cognitive condition of someone who understands;

sentences.sentence: "he has virtually no understanding of social cause and effect"
"arrogance and lack of taste contributed to his rapid success"
"to ask at that particular time was the ultimate in bad taste"

means.word_mean: 3. perception of that which is obscure
5. the trait of judging wisely and objectively;

auth_sentence.content: Discernment on that would be real leadership indeed.
auth_sentence.res_content: Discernment on that would be real leadership indeed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Discernment on that would be real leadership indeed.

auth_sentence.content: The savage...has a quicker discernment of the track than the civilized man.

auth_sentence.content: Unfortunately, Charles's political judgment did not march his aesthetic discernment.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"分开,分离,去掉"; 2. 表示"否定,不,消失掉"
